name: Artichoke - Jerusalem
description: Jerusalem artichokes are tubers which look a little like knobbly potatoes. They are also called earth apple, and are a species of sunflower native to eastern North America. They were first cultivated by the native Americans. Plants were taken to France in 1605 and by the mid-1600s, the Jerusalem artichoke had become a very common vegetable for human consumption in Europe.

name: Asparagus
description: Asparagus originated in the Eastern Mediterranean and was a favourite of the Greeks and Romans who used it as a medicine.
